attributes.Title: S-Teaching Assistant/1st Year
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Social & Behavioral Science
395T
UMass Amherst
This course is for SBS who want to learn to teach their peers to be successful in college. Students assist a primary instructor in the teaching of a First Year Seminar that meets weekly throughout the semester. In addition, some assignments will occasionally require working with the FY students outside of class. Students in this class meet weekly in their own seminar where they discuss issues around classroom management, teaching techniques, and organizational skills, such as working with Moodle.
Open to Seniors and Juniors in the College of Social & Behavioral Sciences.   Students must be enrolled in an SBS major, and have earned at least 60 credits and a 3.0 cumulative GPA.
An initial meeting with the primary instructor is required to get permission to take the course. Prior experience as a Peer Mentor or Orientation Leader is a plus. This course is appropriate for students interested in a career in education, the helping professions and/or a graduate degree in the social and behavioral sciences.
Varies from 1 to 3 credits
Permission is required for interchange registration during all registration periods.
71037

attributes.Title: FYS - Pathways:Roadmap/ColSucc
attributes.Description:
Spring
2016
Social & Behavioral Science
191SBS4
UMass Amherst
There is more than one way to find success in college and the path to getting there is different for every student. This class will help incoming students define their individual goals and connect them to the resources needed to achieve these goals. Through activities and exercises students will discover the many academic and co-curricular activities available at UMass and begin creating their own roadmap to graduation.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
70748

attributes.Title: ST-Take Charge/College Success
attributes.Description:
Fall
2015
Social & Behavioral Science
197S
UMass Amherst
Advance your success as a college student! Through weekly workshops, presentations and assignments you will develop study and writing skills, understand own values system and connect with campus mentors.
Open to any SBS student.
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
39940

attributes.Title: S-A Taste of SBS
attributes.Description:
Spring
2015
Social & Behavioral Science
191T
UMass Amherst
For students new to UMass and the College of Social & Behavioral Sciences, this course prepares students to set academic and personal goals, take full advantage of University offerings, build self-reliance through college-level study skills, and ready themselves for success.
This class is scheduled at 8:30AM but will not meet until 8:45AM in W-13 Machmer Hall.
Varies from 1 to 3 credits
Permission is required for interchange registration during the add/drop period only.
